content.raw: Ok, that is clear then \(note that the docs  [http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.6&elem=physics#physics\_type](http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.6&elem=physics#physics_type) say that it is ode if it is left unspecified, but actually the attribute is required\). This problem of the `physics` element being Classic Gazebo-specific I guess it is another instance of [https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/issues/93/change-the-sdf-spec-to-make-less-gazebo](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/issues/93/change-the-sdf-spec-to-make-less-gazebo) , i.e. a Classic Gazebo aspect that leaked in the SDF spec. Probably it could make sense to mention it there.
content.html: Ok, that is clear then (note that the docs http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.6&elem=physics#physics_type say that it is ode if it is left unspecified, but actually the attribute is required). This problem of the physics element being Classic Gazebo-specific I guess it is another instance of https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/issues/93/change-the-sdf-spec-to-make-less-gazebo , i.e. a Classic Gazebo aspect that leaked in the SDF spec. Probably it could make sense to mention it there.
